title: Indian Troops Need to Leave Maldives, Incoming President Says
description: Maldives intends to be “fully independent” and will ask Indian troops stationed in the island nation to leave, says President-elect Mohamed Muizzu, as New Delhi and Beijing both vie for influence in the region.

title: Trudeau Rolls Back Carbon Plan Under Pressure From Voters
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau suspended a carbon price on oil used for home heating, bowing to political pressure in Canada’s eastern provinces just months after the tax came into effect.

title: Lithium Frenzy: Australia Briefing
description: Good morning, it's Georgie here in Sydney. Here’s what you need to know today...Today’s must-reads:• Lithium rush heats up with SQM’s $1 billion Azure buy• RBA staff threaten strike over pay• US stocks drop on a rout in Big Tech, Aussie futures flat

title: George Santos Faces Expulsion Vote in US House Next Week
description: Indicted New York Representative George Santos faces a vote next week by fellow lawmakers on expelling him from the US House.

title: Yellen’s View on Treasury Yields at Odds With Some Bond Pros
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economic policy reporter Christopher Condon writes on Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen’s interview with Bloomberg News. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Iran Warns the US Won’t Be Spared If Israel-Hamas War Spreads
description: Iran’s foreign minister warned that the US won’t escape unaffected if the Hamas-Israel war turns into a broader conflict, firing back after the Biden administration said Iran was ultimately to blame for a recent spate of drone attacks on American forces.

title: New House Speaker Meets Biden to Discuss Funding Requests
description: Newly minted House Speaker Mike Johnson met Thursday with President Joe Biden as the White House pushed Republican lawmakers to act quickly on their emergency requests for additional foreign aid and disaster recovery spending.

title: Navy's New ICBM Subs Expected to Cost $20 Billion More Than Budget
description: The US Navy’s plan to build 12 submarines carrying intercontinental ballistic missiles may run at least 20% — or $20 billion — over budget, a black eye for a program that’s the centerpiece of the service’s modernization plans.

title: China Set to Skip Ukraine Talks as Zelenskiy Blueprint Struggles
description: China is not expected to attend a meeting of national security advisers in Malta this weekend where officials from more than 55 nations will discuss Ukraine’s drive to build support for its so-called peace formula.

title: UK Tory Lawmaker Blunt Says He Was Arrested Over Rape Allegation
description: A veteran Member of Parliament in Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s UK Conservative Party said he was arrested in connection with a rape allegation that he denies.

title: Yellen Says GDP Data Show US Economy Is ‘Doing Very Well’
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said third-quarter growth data show the US economy is doing very well and that there is evidence of a soft landing, where inflation has eased without causing a recession.

title: Serbia, Kosovo Get Blunt Message From EU Leaders to End Tension
description: Serbia and Kosovo were told to dial back mounting tensions during a meeting with the leaders of Germany, France and Italy on the sidelines of a European Union summit in Brussels.

title: Biden Renews Call to Ban Assault Weapons After Maine Shooting
description: President Joe Biden renewed his call for congressional Republicans to support a ban on assault rifles and other stricter limits on firearms after a mass shooting in Maine that left at least 18 people dead and more than a dozen wounded.

title: Angola Steps Up Currency Curbs to Stem Kwanza Decline
description: Angola’s central bank is stepping up restrictions on foreign-exchange trading to stop the kwanza from weakening further, as Africa’s second-biggest oil producer grapples with a shortage of US dollars.

title: Canada’s Supreme Court to Be Majority Women for First Time
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is set to make Canada’s nine-seat Supreme Court a majority of women for the first time in its history, going back nearly 150 years.

title: Israel Taps Blacklisted Pegasus Maker to Track Hostages in Gaza
description: Israel’s security services are pulling in spyware companies, including the maker of the controversial Pegasus software, to help track hostages in the Gaza Strip, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Ethiopia’s Abiy Seeks to Calm Tensions Over Red Sea Aspirations
description: Ethiopia won’t use force to attain direct access to a Red Sea port, Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed said, toning down previous remarks directed at the landlocked Horn of Africa nation’s neighbors.

title: India Seeks Details After 8 Citizens Get Death Penalty in Qatar
description: India’s government said it’s exploring legal options after it received initial information that eight of its citizens were given the death penalty in Qatar.

title: AI Risks & Rewards: PM Urges Restraint On Rules
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Tusk Hopes EU May Unlock First Funds for Poland in December
description: Poland’s Donald Tusk said he could access European Union funding as soon as December if he’s able to form a new governing coalition.

title: Nigerian Supreme Court Confirms President Tinubu’s Election Win
description: Nigeria’s Supreme Court rejected petitions by two opposition leaders to have President Bola Tinubu’s election declared illegal, bringing an end to an eight-month legal battle to overturn the results of the nation’s closest vote since the return to democracy in 1999.

title: EU Leaders Seek Unity on Ensuring Aid Reaches Gaza as War Rages
description: European Union leaders are moving closer to calling for “humanitarian pauses” in the Israel-Hamas war to ensure aid reaches Gaza as they try to address concerns about effectively helping Hamas regroup.

title: China Releases Videos Showing ‘Provocative’ Actions by US Ship
description: China’s military released video footage that it said shows “provocative” actions by a US warship in the South China Sea, escalating a dispute between the nations over maneuvers by their navies in the disputed body of water.

title: Poland to Convene Parliament on Nov. 13 After Ballot, Duda Says
description: Polish President Andrzej Duda will convene parliament on Nov. 13, starting the handover process after three opposition parties jointly won a majority in this month’s general election.

title: Rising Civilian Toll in Gaza Puts Pressure on Israel
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Russia’s Frozen Cash Earns €3 Billion as EU Haggles Over How to Tap It
description: Sanctioned Russian assets frozen in Belgium have generated nearly €3 billion ($3.2 billion) in profits as European Union states continue to haggle over what to do with the money.

title: Thailand Renews Efforts to Guarantee Rights of Same-Sex Couples
description: Thailand is reviving plans to guarantee greater rights for same-sex couples, with a plan to submit a new bill to the country’s parliament in December that could make it the first Southeast Asian nation to legalize marriage equality.

title: The War That Broke Social Media
description: The platforms that found popularity by helping disseminate trustworthy, real-time information now seem to showcase anger, chaos and infighting.

title: Ukraine Recap: Zelenskiy to Urge EU to Tighten Russia Sanctions
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will ask European Union leaders meeting in Brussels Thursday to expand sanctions against Russia to impede the Kremlin’s ability to resupply, as allies brace for a long war and military support for Ukraine becomes more pressing.

title: US-China Ties Quietly Improving Even as Global Turmoil Surges
description: With the Israel-Hamas war further dividing a world shaken by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and elevated inflation, US-China ties are suddenly providing cause for some optimism.

title: Israel Latest: Army Attacks Targets in Northern Gaza Ground Raid
description: Israel’s military said it made limited ground raids inside northern Gaza overnight to attack Hamas targets before withdrawing. It’s the latest in a series of small incursions that may also be aimed at rescuing hostages and gathering intelligence.

title: Maine Police Pursue Suspect After 16 Reported Dead in Shootings
description: Police in Maine are pursuing a suspect in a mass shooting that has left at least 16 people dead in a pair of incidents in the city of Lewiston, according to local media and officials.

title: Iran-Sudan Rapprochement Threatens to Deepen Deadly Civil War
description: Iran is quietly rebuilding ties with Sudan, stoking concern the Islamic Republic will widen its military influence on the fringes of the Middle East and deepen a disastrous civil war.

title: Saudi Arabia’s ‘New Middle East’ Has a Problem: The Old One
description: On this week’s In the City, we look at Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s vision of regional prosperity, and whether it can survive the Israel-Hamas war.

title: Ukraine to Forge Ahead With Cuts as Prices Ease
description: Ukraine’s central bank is likely to deliver a third straight interest-rate cut as sliding inflation eased pressure on the war-battered economy and the nation’s currency responded positively to a loosening of capital controls.

title: Thailand Bets on EVs to Draw Trillion Baht in Foreign Investment
description: Thailand, renowned as the ‘Detroit of Asia’ for its production of internal combustion engine cars, wants to break into the top tier of electric vehicle makers as part of a goal to lure 1 trillion baht ($28 billion) of foreign investments in four years.

title: South Africa’s Ruling ANC Sees Support Slip to 45% in Survey
description: Support for South Africa’s ruling African National Congress has slipped while the main opposition party, the Democratic Alliance, is growing in popularity, according to a survey.

title: Biden Warns China Not to Attack Philippine Ships After Incidents
description: President Joe Biden warned China that the US would be forced to intervene if Beijing attacks Philippine vessels in the South China Sea, after two separate collisions in the disputed waterway over the weekend.

title: Biden Will See China’s Foreign Minister on Friday in Washington
description: President Joe Biden will see Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi when he visits the White House on Friday, a courtesy gesture that could lay the groundwork for a leaders’ meeting next month, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: China Premier Urges Stepped Up Trade, Investment With Russia
description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang told his Russian counterpart that he wants to boost their trade and other cooperation, underscoring the nations’ close ties with the war in Ukraine well into its second year.

title: Police Tell Maine Residents to Shelter in Place Due to Active Shooter Situation
description: LEWISTON, Maine (AP) — At least 10 people have been killed in shootings in Lewiston, Maine, and the death toll is expected to rise, two law enforcement officials told The Associated Press.

title: Folksy Champion of Christian Right Mike Johnson Is New GOP Speaker
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson introduced himself to the American public Wednesday by repeatedly invoking his evangelical Christian faith, signaling a political shift that will permeate debate on everything from abortion to the economy.
